thread.title: Horror buggy crash leaves Queensland woman critical as two others die in deadly start to holiday long weekend
thread.title_full: Horror buggy crash leaves Queensland woman critical as two others die in deadly start to holiday long weekend

author: VNExplorer
title: Horror buggy crash leaves Queensland woman critical as two others die in deadly start to holiday long weekend
text:
Woman critical after buggy rolloverTwo others dead on Queensland roads READ MORE: Young couple and their housemate are tragically killed in a horror single-car crash on a remote stretch of road
A woman is fighting for life following a horror buggy roll over in the central highlands of Queensland.
Emergency services were called to a buggy crash involving two people in Duargina, west of Rockhampton at around 1.35pm on Friday.
A buggy has rolled in Queensland with a woman left in a critcal condition. Picture: 7News
The woman, aged in her 40s, was treated at the Apis Creek Rd site for head and leg injuries before being flown to hospital in a critical condition.
The second person, a teenage boy, was also treated at the scene for a head injury before being taken to hospital in a stable condition.
Elsewhere in Queensland, an 18-year-old man died after his vehicle rolled off the Bruce Highway and crashed at Ambrose, about 30km from Gladstone, on Friday evening.
The driver, from Toolooa, died at the scene after the car left the road near Gentle Annie Road about 6.30pm.
Two passengers – a 17-year-old male from Toolooa and a 19-year-old man from South Gladstone man – suffered non-life-threatening injuries and were assessed at Gladstone Hospital.
Early on Saturday morning, a 27-year-old man from the north-west Brisbane suburb of Ashgrove died after his motorbike crashed into a pole.
Police said the rider was travelling along Waterworks Road shortly after midnight when his bike veered off the road and smashed into a pole.
He sustained critical injuries and died at the scene.
